articles.title: Mick Mulvaney on "Face the Nation": White House hasn't finalized list of cuts to fund border wall
articles.description: "A list of a decision that's already been made saying, 'This money is going to be cut and spent over there,' that's not been made yet," Mulvaney said
articles.content: Acting White House chief of staff Mick Mulvaney said "it could be a while" before lawmakers receive a final list of what programs are going to lose funding in order to finance President Trump's long-promised border wall, suggesting the White House has yet to … [+2312 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Nature: Cardinals in the snow
articles.description: "Sunday Morning" takes us to Loganville, Pennsylvania, where cardinals prove to be true standouts. Videographer: Brad Markel.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: "Where the Crawdads Sing" author Delia Owens
articles.description: For the last six months "Where the Crawdads Sing" has been a fixture on The New York Times' Bestsellers List. The novel by Delia Owens is a love story, murder mystery, courtroom drama, and ode to the outdoors all in one. Lee Cowan paid a visit to Owens at her…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Calendar: Week of March 18
articles.description: From the National Cherry Blossom Festival to National Puppy Day, "Sunday Morning" takes a look at some notable events of the week ahead. Jane Pauley reports.

articles.author: Emily Tillett
articles.title: Tim Kaine on "Face the Nation" says Trump "emboldens" white nationalists
articles.description: "He's not creating them. They're out there," Kaine said of white nationalists, days after a deadly mass shooting in New Zealand
articles.content:
Days after a deadly attack on two mosques in New Zealand by a gunman who appeared to align with the white supremacist movement, Virginia Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine said President Trump's rhetoric emboldens white nationalists around the world. 
"The president … [+1791 chars]

articles.title: New Zealand terror attack: "The carpet has been pulled out from under us"
articles.description: Friday's attack on two mosques in Christchurch, in which a gunman espousing white nationalist rhetoric shot dozens of Muslim men, women and children, murdering at least 50, killed more than are normally killed in all of New Zealand in a year. Ben Tracy has th…

articles.author: Emily Tillett
articles.title: Mulvaney defends Trump's response to New Zealand attack
articles.description: "Donald Trump is no more to blame for what happened in New Zealand than Mark Zuckerberg is because he invented Facebook," said Mulvaney
articles.content: Acting White House chief of staff Mick Mulvaney defended President Trump against criticism he has not explicitly called out white supremacy in the wake of a deadly attack on two mosques in New Zealand. mass shooting. Mulvaney told "Face the Nation" Mr. Trump … [+2464 chars]

articles.title: "Veep" returns
articles.description: The HBO comedy starring Julia Louis-Dreyfus as the one-time Veep and accidental president enters its seventh and final season, and if there is one lesson to take from the hit show, it's that in comedy, as in life, nothing good ever comes easy. Tracy Smith tal…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: "Danny Boy" by the Choral Scholars of University College, Dublin
articles.description: For St. Patrick's Day "Sunday Morning" was graced in the studio by a visit from the Choral Scholars of University College, Dublin, who performed "Danny Boy." For more check out the group's website at ucdchoralscholars.ie.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: WWII vet runs across America, again
articles.description: Ernie Andrus, who served in the Navy in World War II, was celebrated back in 2016 when, at the age of 93, he became the oldest person ever to run across America, making the trip from San Diego all the way to St. Simons Island, Georgia. But he recently got so …

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Inside America's Test Kitchen
articles.description: It's an empire built on testing new dishes and putting kitchen gadgets through their paces, using both staff chefs and food stylists, as well as 17,000 volunteer cooks from around the country to test recipes. America's Test Kitchen, based in Boston, is featur…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: The Vessel: Thomas Heatherwick's oversized public art structure
articles.description: It's the centerpiece of the largest and most expensive private real estate development in American history: "Vessel," a 150-foot-tall sculpture in the middle of Hudson Yards, a new 16-building complex on the West Side of Manhattan. The honeycombed flight of f…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Bayernhof, an eccentric millionaire's home-turned-museum
articles.description: Charles Brown III left behind a mansion that was museum-worthy, from its secret passages to the more than 140 antique music-making machines that turn the 19,000-sq.-ft. Pennsylvania home into a veritable orchestra. Conor Knighton reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: One teenager's tragic hidden secret
articles.description: High school junior Alexandra Valoras, a straight-A student, class officer and robotics whiz, nonetheless felt she wasn't ever good enough; hiding her despair behind a sunny disposition to the outside world, she ended her life before her 18th birthday. Jim Axe…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Almanac: Nat King Cole
articles.description: One hundred years ago, on March 17, 1919, Nathaniel Adams Coles, who became renowned as Nat King Cole, the singer with an "unforgettable" voice, was born. Jane Pauley reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Teen suicide: A lost girl's diary - The hidden anguish of Alexandra Valoras
articles.description: The high school junior was a straight-A student, class officer and robotics whiz, who nonetheless felt she wasn't ever good enough – signs she kept hidden until she ended her life
articles.content: Alexandra Valoras would look so familiar to so many parents – the sweet little girl singing and dancing her way through her teen years, recognized for achieving outside the home, and thoroughly cherished inside it. "Alexandra, she was such a happy girl, so mo… [+7286 chars]
